# Statistical Exploration

## Libraries
```{r message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
library(lme4)
```

## Declare variables
```{r variables}


```


## Correlation
```{r}
text1$dur[is.na(text1$dur)] <- 0
cor(text1$word_length,text1$dur)
```



```{r}
lm(text1$dur ~ text1$AAPz)
```

For the log-transformation, values that are 0 must be adjusted.
There are multiple options for handling missing values. While they could be removed, this would lead to a loss of data. 
```
# remove missing values
text1 <- na.omit(text1)
```
Another approach is to set it to a very low value, for example 1ms.
```{r handle_missing_values}

```


```{r log_transform}
dv <- log(text1$dur)
result <- lm(dv ~ text1$AAPz)
summary(result)
```

```{r}
t2 <- lmer(dv ~ text1$AAPz + (1 + text1$AAPz | text1$word_length))
summary(t2)
```


```{r}
t2 <- lmer(dv ~ AAPz + (1 + AAPz | participant_id) + (1 + AAPz | word_length), data = text1)
summary(t2)
```

```{r error_convergence}
t2 <- lmer(dv ~ AAPz + (1 + AAPz | participant_id) + (1 + AAPz | word_length) + (1 + AAPz | frequency), data = text1)
```
